title: Camille support?
body: Anyone else playing Camille support? played it a couple games and it seems really strong, especially just going tank with her and soaking everything up late game

replies.body:
She offers no support qualities besides her ultimate, which helps her duel not her team catch people. 

Her supporting qualities are about the same as {{champion:121}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:24}}  support.

I wouldn't put her supporting ability in with those 3. It would be more along the lines of Support-tank Riven, in all honesty, (Pre-6). gap-closing stun (On a relatively short cooldown if it's maxed first), shield, early game damage (Which is nice because it's not affected by items)

> [{quoted}](name=BladedEssence,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mXpRbXmW,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-12-14T06:54:02.257+0000)
>
> I wouldn't put her supporting ability in with those 3. It would be more along the lines of Support-tank Riven, in all honesty, (Pre-6). gap-closing stun (On a relatively short cooldown if it's maxed first), shield, early game damage (Which is nice because it's not affected by items)

The problem with camille is she has to be very all in (hence my {{champion:121}} comparison, I've done this before its basically kill somebody or die.). The issue is she could E to a wall, and easily get counter stunned / binded / whatever by the other supports or even ADs like cait and vayne. Its a predictable pattern she does as the moment she goes to a wall you already know what to do. If she can't all in correctly and consistently, then the only other quality she would need inorder to be useful to her AD is heals (nope) tankiness (nope, not early or mid game) and protection (a clutch suicidal E to save an AD maybe, but nothing special.)

The only excuse to play camille support is "its fun." 

Riven wouldn't be too far off from a comparison, but riven atleast does have both damage, a couple methods of chain CC, and a reliable consistent shield she gets without having to actually fight for it, making her less bullied. 

Her ultimate could make flashy plays, i could see support camille but a niche counter pick to leblanc since the moment she dives camille can ult her.

well if you pattern your engage to be the same every time you deserve to either die or have it fail, pretty simple. and she can get out, once you play her a little bit you know that you have the opportunity to disengage, save your engage if you have someone with a skillshot cc to e dodge then go in, or e dodge then get out. Its not all in all the time. Everythings situational.

I agree a lot of champs have predictable patterns. That alistar isn't gonna surprise me when I see him coming not blitz nor naut. With every support you have tradeoffs that you decide if they're acceptable. Some only offer kill potential and a body to block shots others have healing and buffs/debuffs to help keep the lane stable or turn a fight. Camille has things to help her support like: a strong slow, a stun+gap closer(that doubles as an escape that other supports lack), good damage and tankiness for fighting, and low mana cost allowing her to stay active. You can argue that others could do some of that too but not like she does. It's like when people argued why play Sona when there is nami or blitz when there is thresh or talon when there is zed. They're different and have something that the other doesn't. Also her ult with mf is a fun wombo.

she has a hard engage level 2? and can immediately follow it up with a slow. I dunno, I guess I just like how aggro she can be, and can easily snowball a carry and her ult can help with ganks on top of that

Why? You can soak up damage with the likes of an Alistar, and have 3x the utility that a support Camille could offer. 

This seems to becoming a pattern, once a champion is released/reworked, people play "Will it Support?" more often than "Will in Jungle?" 

Yet the problem with this train of thought is, you think of the possibilities, without considering the opportunity costs.
That would be thinking rationally but pessimistically..lol

No tank stats (_her passive doesn't count as one_)

No team-supportive utility (_even J4 or Yorick's wall works better than her "wall"_)

No team protection (_such as saving your ADC with Morg's Q/Tahm's W/Janna's Q_)

Conclusion: Just don't...

For low elo I do want to say that I have a 7 game winstreak as only Camille support. She has to be picked into lanes that are a bit lower on cc. Obviously vayne lux will stomp her if you go for wall stun everytime, but against sona or soraka for example she can easily maneuver and lock an ADC. Also she trades like a beast, courage plus her passive makes her very hard to successfully whittle, and she stays combat ready with around 100 mana. 

She has cons but comparing her to riven and jayce is honestly incorrect. Camille has a stupid quick gap close, her shield will be bigger than riven, even if some of it can only block ADC/supp damage. She has built in sustain that has a moving cast, allowing her to evade a large variety of skill shots while trading and escaping, while riven is stationary while she q3s. Also she can do some insanely clutch saves. Mainly coming from the fact you can queue tac sweep while hooking, allowing you to bounce and move back, slowing them a .5 seconds before the stun ends. And she can do this though thick walls if she has vision of the aggressors. 

Back to her cons:
Weaker to cc than most champs (her kit involves second casting a lot)
Can be predictable, and requires creative play to succeed
Can be counter picked easily, don't take her every game unless you know how to win the matchup. Blitz in particular dumps on you
Isn't exceptionally tanky until mid-late game, making her rely on her courage shield more than Ali or naut.
Slow can be hard to land in some matchups, Lucian and ez, but her ADC can follow up if you position right.
I'm not saying it is the best thing ever, but it is much more than a meritless troll pick.
I truly want to see it be played in plat+, so I can point to a good player, rather than myself. (You can check my lolstarz, I'm undefeated with Camille support right now.)

That's up there with Jayce support.

Fun but not really a good idea.

Although I do want to try Jayce support.
